value.title: Document your Power BI Desktop models with DAX Studio!

value.title: After Union Two tables, data goes to the wrong column with Power BI DAX?
value.excerpt: Most of us have used Union DAX expression in Power BI. Basically union, appends rows from both the table which are common. In Power BI, sometimes, when we perform Union operation, the combined data have some inconsistent mechanism, meaning one column's data merged with another column. The main reason

value.title: Find and Remove Last Occurrence from a String using Power BI DAX
value.excerpt: During this session, we will learn how we can find and remove last occurrence from a string using Power BI DAX. This is equivalent to Text Before Delimitator property in Power Query. value.title: Power BI DAX Measures: Understanding Filter Context using DATESYTD Example (I.C.A.N. Rule)

Rule; using a DATESYTD Example. I. Incoming Filters C. CALCULATE does it‚Äôs Magic! A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI   Using GroupBy Function in DAX
value.excerpt: There are many different ways you can create aggregations in Power BI, You can do it in the source (using the database t-SQL language), or using Group By operation in Power Query. You can also do it in DAX using some functions. One of the functions that can be used for grouping and aggregation is Group

value.title: All in One Script to Create Calendar Table or Date Dimension using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have previously written an article with the full script of how to generate a date dimension in Power BI using the Power Query script, and I would always recommend that as the first choice. However, sometimes, you just want this to be in DAX way, so here in this blog and video, I explained how to create

value.title: Create a subset of the table in Power BI and add calculations using SELECTCOLUMNS DAX Function

value.title: Explicit Vs Implicit DAX Measures in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you ever tried to connect to a Power BI dataset from Excel using Analyze in Excel? if yes, you might have had this experience that your values don‚Äôt show in Excel‚Äôs Pivot table as values. This is because those values are not explicit measures, they are implicit measures in Power BI. In this article
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/f7g6EvNGClQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: In Power BI, there are multiple ways of searching for a text term inside a text field, you can use Power Query for doing this operation or calculations in DAX. In this video, I'll explain some functions in DAX that you can use to do this calculation. Most of these functions can be used inside a measure

value.title: How to use AddColumns function in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: AddColumns is a DAX function that is helpful often when writing calculations in Power BI. In this article and video, I‚Äôll explain how you can use it to add calculated columns on the fly to the virtual tables in measures or directly in a table. download the Power BI file from my blog article here: https://radacad.com/how-to-use-addcolumns-function-in-dax-and-power-bi

value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression
value.excerpt: Substring is one of the most common functions in many languages, However, there is no such function in DAX. There is a very simple way of doing it, which I am going to explain in this post. Substring means getting part of a string, for example from "Reza Rad", if I want to get the start starting from

value.title: SUM vs SUMX What is the Difference of the two DAX Functions in Power BI
value.excerpt: Sum and Sumx are functions that often founded to be misleading for many Power BI users. As both functions are doing the aggregation, it seems a bit confusing what is the actual difference between these two. There are many blog posts and articles about each function. I always explain the difference with

value.title: Writing calculations on a real time streaming Power BI dataset using DAX measures
value.excerpt: In the previous article and video, I explained a method that you can use to have real-time calculations in a Power BI streaming dataset. The calculations done that way are limited though because it is using the Q&A feature of Power BI. If you are after a complex calculation then DAX can definitely help.
